page.title: 03COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: Below Ingram,the area is criss-crossed with narrow roads,none of which are graded any better than 'C'class.Below Reaveley Bridge passing is easy between two cars,but,above the bridge one if not both cars would need to pull onto the grass-verge.A good deal of road in the area is unfenced.Above Ingram there is but one narrow road which is for the most part unfenced.In addition to these County Council owned roads,there are many rough tracks between steadings that are suitable only for tractors or four-wheel drive vehicles.There is one bridge across the Breamish in this grid.This is at Ingram.
